fields.name: Porsche Example
fields.description: Illustrates support for Issue-Based Information Systems (IBIS) and cumulative arguments. Needs to be revised to used weighed sums.
fields.data:
meta:
  title: Porsche Example
  notes: > 
    Illustrates support for Issue-Based Information Systems (IBIS) 
    and cumulative arguments. Needs to be revised to used weighed sums.
  source: > 
      Brewka, Gerhard, and Thomas F. Gordon. "How to Buy a Porsche: An Approach to Defeasible Decision Making ." Working Notes of the AAAI-94 Workshop on Computational Dialectics. Seattle, Washington, 1994. 28-38. 


statements:
  Porsche: Buy a Porsche.
  Volvo: Buy a Volvo.
  price(Volvo)=med: Volvos have a medium price.
  type(Volvo)=family: Volvos are family cars.
  speed(Volvo)=med: Volvos have a medium maximum speed.
  safety(Volvo)=high: Volvos are very safe.
  safety(Volvo)=med:  Volve are fairly safe.
  type(Porsche)=sports: Porsches are sports cars.
  price(Porsche)=high: Porsches are expensive.
  safety(Porsche)=med: Porsches are fairly safe.
  speed(Porsche)=fast: Porsches are fast.
  advertising: Volvo advertising claims Volvos are safe.
  gov-stats: Government statistics show Volvos to be fairly safe.

issues:
  i1:
    positions: [Porsche, Volvo]
  i2:
    positions: [safety(Volvo)=med, safety(Volvo)=high]

arguments:
  a1: 
    scheme: cumulative
    conclusion: Porsche
    premises: 
      - type(Porsche)=sports
      - price(Porsche)=high
      - safety(Porsche)=med
      - speed(Porsche)=fast
  a2:
    scheme: cumulative
    conclusion: Volvo
    premises:
      - type(Volvo)=family
      - price(Volvo)=med
      - speed(Volvo)=med
      - safety(Volvo)=high
  a3:
    conclusion: safety(Volvo)=high
    premises:
      - advertising
  a4:
    conclusion: safety(Volvo)=med
    premises:
      - gov-stats

assumptions:
  - advertising
  - gov-stats
  - price(Volvo)=med
  - speed(Volvo)=med
  - type(Volvo)=family
  - type(Porsche)=sports
  - price(Porsche)=high
  - safety(Porsche)=med
  - speed(Porsche)=fast

labels:
  in:
    - advertising
    - gov-stats
    - price(Volvo)=med
    - speed(Volvo)=med
    - type(Volvo)=family
    - type(Porsche)=sports
    - price(Porsche)=high
    - safety(Porsche)=med
    - speed(Porsche)=fast
    - Porsche
  out:
    - safety(Volvo)=high
    - safety(Volvo)=med
    - Volvo

fields.name: The Frisian Example
fields.data:
meta:
  title: The Frisian Example
  source: > 
    Prakken, H. An abstract framework for argumentation with 
    structured arguments. Argument & Computation 1, (2010), 93-124.

statements: 
  dutch: 
    text: Wiebe is Dutch.
    label: in
  tall: 
    text: Wiebe is tall.
    label: in
  frisian: 
    text: Wiebe is Frisian.
    label: in
  ¬app(a1): 
    text: a1 is not applicable.
    label: out

assumptions: [frisian]

arguments:
  a1: 
    conclusion: dutch
    premises: [frisian]
    undercutter: ¬app(a1)
  a2:
    conclusion: tall
    premises: [dutch]
